Perrier Sparkling Water.description: Elegant, sparkling and refreshing, with  just a hint of zaniness... PERRIER is unique.

Art In The Age Rhubarb Tea Organic Lique.description: If you grew up in rural Pennsylvania, chances are you’ve consumed your share of rhubarb. Pies, teas, jams…for a few months a year, it seems like it’s everywhere and in everything. The roots of the Keystone State’s rhubarbiness go all the way back to our favorite insanely industrious and pioneering founding father, Ben Franklin.    Aside from leading a revolution and discovering electricity, Franklin was an avid agriculturalist and best friend of botanist John Bartram. In fact, Franklin brought the first rhubarb seeds from Europe to America as a gift for Mr. Bartram in 1771. (Bartram’s Garden in Philadelphia is America’s oldest botanical garden. If you haven’t visited, you really should.) Point in fact, rhubarb originally came from China, where it was used as an herbal tonic. In the late 18th century, cane sugar became more affordable, which changed the way rhubarb was enjoyed.    Upon discovering the capacity of sugar to release the wonders of the plant’s intrinsic flavor, rhubarb migrated from a fold tonic to a tasty treat. Legend has it, Bartram was so enthused with rhubarb, he concocted a lovely garden tea showcasing his new botanical prize. We were mulling over this story when we came up with the idea of creating our own Art in the Age garden spirit in Mr. Bartram’s honor.    We are proud to offer you RHUBARB Tea! RHUBARB Tea features a botanical bounty of beets, carrots, lemons, petitgrain, cardamom, pure cane sugar, and of course, Bartram’s prize rhubarb. All organically certified and delicious. A confident 80 proof spirit that’s tangy but not too tangy–sweet, but not too sweet. Crisp and refreshing, but with a hint of spice. We guarantee there’s never been anything else like it…at least not since 1771. (Oh, and just to let you know, finding a source for organically certified rhubarb was quite a feat, so please savor every drop.)

The Grey Goose Martini.description: The perfect, elegant cocktail to enjoy with friends and family at a distinguished holiday party. The martini is perhaps the world's most iconic cocktail. Our version is stirred, never shaken. Stirring avoids over-dilution of the martini cocktail, establishes a perfectly clear liquid without air bubbles, and ensures a smoother mouth feel. Served dry, but not too dry, with 5 parts vodka to 1 part vermouth, a dash of orange bitters, and then garnished with a twist of lemon. Grey Goose has more taste than other vodkas because it's built from the ground up to express the nature of its ingredients, not to remove them. This means it will stand up perfectly to the vermouth.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 part Noilly Prat Original French Dry Vermouth
The Grey Goose Martini.name: The Grey Goose Martini
The Grey Goose Martini.recipeInstructions: Build ingredients in a mixing glass. Top with cubed ice and stir. Fine strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon peel

Grey Goose Vodka.description: GREY GOOSE® Vodka is crafted with only the finest French ingredients - soft winter wheat and Gensac spring water. The unique once distilled production process is designed to bring out the superior characteristics of these ingredients.

Noilly Prat Original Dry Vermouth.description: Noilly Prat is the most famous of all Vermouths, a dry, straw-hued vermouth from Marseillan, in the Hérault département of southern France. Joseph Noilly, an herbalist, developed the first formula in 1813. It was the first example of a dry vermouth and is among the golden, straw and white vermouths generally known as "French Vermouth".

Fee Brothers Orange Bitters.description: The best bartenders and master-Mixologists know the secret to a happy customer is the magic that goes into every creation. The fine flavor of this product is obtained principally from the skins of oranges grown in the West Indies.

The Grigio Gorl.description: Introducing The Grigio Gorl, a sinuous blend of Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, tequila, grapefruit, simple syrup, club soda, and lime that will leave you wondering...who is she?
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano
The Grigio Gorl.name: The Grigio Gorl
The Grigio Gorl.recipeInstructions: Place grapefruit wheel on side of rocks glass and hold in place with ice. In a cocktail shaker combine Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, grapefruit juice, simple syrup, tequila, and lime. Shake well. Strain into prepared glass. Adjust to taste. Top with club soda

Stirrings Simple Syrup.description: Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is a starting point for many great cocktails. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano.description:
Somehow both refreshing and relaxing, our Pinot Grigio Italiano is la dolce vita in a can. Light and breezy with notes of apple and citrus, this wine might be a little too drinkable, if that’s even possible...

Did we mention it’s Italian?

The Last Word.description: First created in the Prohibition era, the Last Word's simple recipe of equal parts Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, Green Chartreuse, Junipero Gin and fresh lime juice belies the subtlety of this sweet-tart-herbal creation. Two men are credited with this cocktail's fame - its creator, vaudevillian Fred Fogarty, who allegedly first combined the four ingredients at the Detroit Athletic Club in 1921, and Seattle bartender Murray Stetson, who revived the Last Word at the Zig Zag Café in the early 2000s.
The Last Word.name: The Last Word
The Last Word.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry

Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur.description: Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur follows the original recipe from 1821, and requires four years to produce. This unique liqueur is a distillation of the leaves, pits, stems, and skins of the Luxardo Marasca Cherries, a sour cherry variety cultivated exclusively by the Luxardo family in the Veneto region of Italy. Each patented, straw-plaited bottle is hand-wrapped, a Venetian method originally used for transporting bottles during sea travel to avoid breakage.  Smooth but sharp, this liqueur has a rounded flavor with notes of cherries and rosewater.  It is an essential ingredient for classic cocktails such as the Aviation, The Last Word, and the Martinez.

Chartreuse Green Liqueur.description: Green Chartreuse is the only liqueur in the world with a completely natural green color. It is powerful and unique. Only two Chartreuse monks know the identity of the 130 plants, how to blend them and how  to distill them into this world famous liqueur. They are also the only ones who know which plants they have to macerate to produce the natural green and yellow colors. And they alone supervise the slow ageing in oak casks.

Junipero Gin.description: Junipero Gin is made by hand in the classic “distilled dry gin” tradition, utilizing more than a dozen botanicals in their natural state, in a small copper pot still at our little distillery on Potrero Hill in San Francisco. The history of gin goes back at least to the mid-1600’s in Holland, but its true antecedents are much earlier, those first experiments in the ancient and mysterious art of distilling in the presence of herbs and spices. The predominant flavor and aroma of a modern gin will always come from juniper (dried berries of the “common juniper,” Juniperus communis). But the wonderful challenge for the distiller is in selecting and blending from a wide variety of additional, exotic botanicals in order to impart a uniquely satisfying, balanced character to his gin. At Anchor Distilling we have taken delight in the adventure of researching and experimenting with many such botanicals. Our final formula must remain a secret, but we hope you will agree that we have achieved a distinctive, intriguing complexity in our Junípero Gin: light and crisp and clean, combining a deep and mysterious spiciness with subtle delicacy.

The New Irish Breakfast.description: With flavors reminiscent of fresh baked banana bread, this Jameson infusion is great on the rocks, or as an unexpected addition to any classic whiskey cocktail. For this recipe we've decided to keep it simple, adding just a few ounces of fresh squeezed orange juice really kicks it up a notch.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz banana-infused Jameson Irish Whiskey

1- 2 oz fresh squeezed orange juice
The New Irish Breakfast.name: The New Irish Breakfast
The New Irish Breakfast.recipeInstructions: In a shaker combine banana-infused whiskey and orange juice, shake until cold.. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over a large icecube. . Garnish with a pinch of black sugar sprinkles.

The North Fork Iced Tea.description: This version of the Long Island Iced Tea is warmed up with a fall-flavored theme. Subbing barrel-aged gin, honey-infused vodka, and aged rum makes for a richer flavor profile. All of these flavors marry perfectly with sparkling cider. The result is a crisp, bright, cozy cocktail that is still deceptively on the strong side.
recipeIngredient: 1 apple, sliced roughly into eighths or large chunks
1 to 1 1/2 ounces cinnamon-honey syrup (see recipe notes)
Fresh apple slices and cinnamon sticks, for garnish
The North Fork Iced Tea.name: The North Fork Iced Tea
The North Fork Iced Tea.recipeInstructions: In a mixing tin, muddle the apple chunks, expressing as much juice as possible.. Add the Old Tom gin, tequila, vodka, rum, dry curaçao, lemon juice, cinnamon-honey syrup, and a couple dashes of bitters.. Fill the tin with ice and shake well. Taste for balance and adjust accordingly, adding a little more lemon juice or simple syrup if necessary.. Carefully double-strain and divide the mixture into two collins glasses filled with fresh ice.. Finish each cocktail with sparkling cider.. Garnish with an apple slice and a cinnamon stick.

Martinelli's Sparkling Cider (Non Alcoho.description: Non-alcoholic version of our founder's original Champagne Cider. Carbonated 100% juice from U.S. grown fresh apples, not from concentrate, with no added sweeteners or preservatives. Vitamin C added to maintain color.

Milagro Anejo Tequila.description: Milagro Anejo is made from 100% estate-grown, hand picked blue agave harvested from the highlands of Jalisco. The heart of the agave is roasted in brick ovens made from the same volcanic-rich soil where the blue agave flourishes in Jalisco, Mexico. Our triple distillation process produces tequila of extraordinary depth and character for unparalleled smoothness. Unlike other Anejos that are aged for one year, Milagro Anejo is aged in single American oak whiskey barrels for 18 months, giving it a distinctive, rich amber color and subtle woody flavor.

Ransom Old Tom Gin.description: This Old Tom Gin is a historically accurate revival of the predominant Gin in fashion during the mid 1800's and the golden age of American cocktails. The recipe was developed in collaboration with historian, author, and mixologist extraordinaire David Wondrich. Old Tom is the Gin for mixing classic cocktails dating from the days before prohibition. Its subtle maltiness is the result of using a base wort of malted barley, combined with an infusion of botanicals in high proof corn spirits. The final distillation is run through an alambic pot still in order to preserve the maximum amount of aromatics, flavor and body. Only the "heart of the hearts" (the very best portion of distillate) is retained for this special bottling.

Spring 44 Honey Flavored Vodka.description: Spring 44 was founded by Jeff Lindauer, who had an annual tradition of drinking from a high mountain spring with his friends (over 9,000 feet!) at midnight. The taste and purity of the water gave rise to the name of their spirits. They use the Rocky Mountain spring water in their spirits, which they believe gives a unique quality to their flavor. While the label is owned by Spring 44 Distilling Company, the filing with the federal Tax and Trade Bureau (as of 2012) locates the source as the Temperance Distilling Company of Michigan, which we have noted here as the producer. Presumably, the recipe and water are delivered via Spring 44 for bottling in Michigan (prior filings suggest an Oregon source with Side Pocket Beverage).    Spring 44 Vodka is made from what they describe as a "proprietary blend of American-grown grain." It is filtered through a special "virgin coconut" carbon (charcoal) process (we don't quite know what a "virgin" coconut is--is there a "sullied" coconut?--but guess it suggests not having been used in any other filtation process). They note that there is not one drop of "munipal" water in the vodka but 100% Rocky Mountain artesian water.    Spring 44 Honey Vodka is their flavored version, using "all natural botanicals." It presents as a pale gold in the bottle.    In an extremely favorable review from Seattle PI, they called it "flawless" and "delicious" and summarized by saying, "If you trust me on nothing else you read this year, trust me here: run out and find these bottles."

The Old Pal.description: This cocktail is a cousin of the Negroni. The rye gives this drink some sweetness paired with the complex flavors of Campari and smoothed out with dry vermouth. If you like Boulevardiers and Negronis give this a try.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Rye Whiskey
3/4 oz Dry Vermouth
3/4 oz Campari
Lemon
The Old Pal.name: The Old Pal
The Old Pal.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass, combine rye, vermouth and Campari. Stir with a bar spoon, then strain into an empty cocktail glass. Garnish with a fresh-cut lemon wheel or twist of lemon peel

Campari.description:
For over 150 years, Campari has been a favorite liqueur for drinkers with different tastes. The liquid is a dark red color and is often mixed with other alcohols and non-alcoholic drinks for cocktails. The drink was created in 1860.
 
Depending on where the Campari is sold, the alcohol content ranges from 20.5 percent to 28 percent. When you smell Campari, you'll be reminded of pomegranate, strawberry, spicy herbs, bitter orange and cherry. The flavor starts off sweet and is followed by an herbal, spicy taste. After that, the bitterness of the drink starts to build. This is a wholly unique drink.

The recipe and creation process of Campari is still a secret to this day. Depending on your source, even the number of ingredients changes (ranging from 20 to 80). However, there are a few ingredients that are known. Campari includes fruits in water and alcohol as well as an infusion of herbs.

The most common ways to drink Campari are in cocktails, with prosecco or with soda water. While you can drink it neat, many have trouble with the bitter taste. Because of this, many of the mixed drinks that use Campari are strong flavored as well.

The most well-known drink using Campari is a Negroni. A Negroni can be served either straight up or on the rocks. All you need for this classic mixed drink is one ounce of dry gin, one ounce of Campari and one ounce of sweet vermouth. Mix these three together either in a mixing glass with ice or mix them right in the glass with some ice.

Another great Campari-based mixed drink is the Jasmine. In a cocktail shaker, combine one-and-a-half ounces of gin, three-quarters of an ounce of fresh-squeezed lemon juice, a quarter ounce of Campari and a quarter ounce of Cointreau. Fill the shaker with ice and shake for about 10 seconds. Strain your drink into a cocktail glass. Don't forget to add a lemon twist garnish for the perfect bold drink.

Buy Campari online through Drizly and have it delivered directly to your door or pick it up in store.

Dolin Dry Vermouth.description: Dolin Vermouths are notably lighter, drier and less pungent than their larger commercial counterparts. The particular mixture of plants found near Chambéry give a fresh, restrained and elegant nose, with a subtle, complex bittersweet palate. Even the Blanc and Rouge retain great balance, with the sugar never cloying, and just enough bitterness to whet the appetite. Each can be enjoyed as aperitif on ice, with a twist of citrus, or in a broad array of traditional cocktails.

Tribuno Dry Vermouth.description: Dry vermouth made in the U.S. Pale straw color. Sweet aromas of ripe grapes, pine needles, and spearmint. Sweet for an 'extra dry'. Grapy flavors. Good for mixing.

The Pace Chaser.description: Bananas are a post-gym favorite, so why not sweeten the deal with a little whiskey shooter? The quirky combo of chocolate protein powder, almond butter, and home-infused whiskey will set the pace for a great night.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Banana Infused Irish Whiskey (We chose Jameson Irish Whiskey)
The Pace Chaser.name: The Pace Chaser
The Pace Chaser.recipeInstructions: Slice a fresh banana into 2-3 pieces making sure that they can stand straight when placed on a flat surface (you don't want your whiskey spilling out). . Using a melon baller gently carve out the interior of the banana leaving the entire peel and about ¼" of banana at the bottom to retain the liquid. . Before you fill, swipe one side of the banana with almond butter and roll in chocolate protein powder. . Fill banana shooter with whiskey and serve.

The Real Housewife.description: Oops, did I do that? Introducing the Raspberry Lemon Drop aka “The Real Housewife," a campy concoction of Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, lemon juice, and raspberry that's just begging to be sipped, sloshed, and ultimately slung in a rival's face. While we don't actually suggest tossing such an exquisite drink in anyone's face, it's fun to turn up the drama every once in a while.
recipeIngredient:
4 ounces Electric Sky
Pinot Grigio Italiano
Lemon Slices for even more drama
The Real Housewife.name: The Real Housewife
The Real Housewife.recipeInstructions: Prepare cocktail glass with raspberry sugar rim. In a cocktail shaker with ice, add Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, lemon, simple syrup, and raspberries. Shake vigorously (also relieves stress). Strain and pour into prepared glass. Garnish with lemon and raspberries, if you're feeling dramatique

Stirrings Simple Syrup.description: Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is a starting point for many great cocktails. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano.description:
Somehow both refreshing and relaxing, our Pinot Grigio Italiano is la dolce vita in a can. Light and breezy with notes of apple and citrus, this wine might be a little too drinkable, if that’s even possible...

Did we mention it’s Italian?

The Rebel.description: The Ritas love rebels - they're known to spice things up. Add some heat to your Lime-A-Rita with jalapeno-infused tequila and rebel a little. #HAVEARITA
The Rebel.name: The Rebel
The Rebel.recipeInstructions: Run a lime wedge around the rim of a highball glass. Rim the edge with chill salt. Fill glass with ice and add Lime-A-Rita and tequila. Garnish with 2 slices of jalapeno and a lime wedge. Enjoy!

RITAS Lime-A-Rita.description: Line up for Lime-A-Rita™! Take a classic margarita, add some fun, and you’ll end up with Lime-A-Rita™. The recipe is open the can. Or if you’re feeling fancy, pour it over ice in a margarita glass. #HAVEARITA

The Royal Sunburn.description: This cocktail incorporates both some light and fresh spirits with some more heavy flavors. The dark rum and absinthe give depth, while the aperol and lemon liquor add a lovely sweetness. When blended together, they combine perfectly to create an interesting, fruity, full-bodied, boozy summer cocktail - sure to help beat the heat!
recipeIngredient: .5 oz Lemon Liquor (I used Etrog, but a limoncello would also work)
4 Dashes Blueberry Cardamon Bitters (or any berry or fig bitters will work)
1.5 oz Green Juice (any fresh pressed green juice will work)
The Royal Sunburn.name: The Royal Sunburn
The Royal Sunburn.recipeInstructions: In a blender add ice, Rum, Aperol, Lemon Liquor, lime juice, green juice, simple syrup, bitters. Blend until combined and frothy. In a chilled rocks or collins glass, coat the inside of the glass with an absinthe rinse. Pour frozen cocktail into rocks glass after the absinthe rinse. Garnish with broubon or luxardo cherries and dried orange wheel. Add 2 more dashes of bitters on top

Myers's Original Dark Rum.description:
Enjoy the unique taste of Caribbean rum with Myers's Original Dark Rum. With the initial aroma of mahogany and charred wood, our dark rum satisfies with a mildly sweet and moderately full-bodied palate of dark caramel and toasted coconut husks. Made with Jamaican molasses, our 100% fine Jamaican rum is expertly boiled, fermented and distilled using both column and pot stills. Matured for up to 4 years in white oak barrels, our rum adds a delicious kick to cocktails and traditional cooking recipes. Simply add with cola and pour over ice for a classic mixed drink.

Myers's Rum gained its namesake in 1879 when founder, Fred L. Myers, started producing rum in Jamaica with his son. Since then, we have maintained his dedication to quality ingredients for every bottle of rum produced. Enjoy over 130 years of good rum with Myers's. Please drink responsibly.

St. George Absinthe.description: Real absinthe. No artificial ingredients, no gimmicks. The first legal American absinthe released after the U.S. ban was lifted in 2007, St. George Absinthe Verte remains one of the most acclaimed and respected spirits in this category.   Made from a host of real botanical ingredients, ours is a layered and evocative expression of this beguiling and highly spirituous herbal elixir.

The Shackleton Highball.description: Add a citrus twist to make this a perfect scotch cocktail!
The Shackleton Highball.name: The Shackleton Highball
The Shackleton Highball.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with cubed ice. Stir with bar spoon for 10 seconds until glass starts to frost. Drain excess water and add Shackleton whisky. Stir for 10 seconds, adding ice as needed. Top with soda and softly stir for 5 seconds. Garnish with lemon oils by rubbing twist around the rim of the glass

Shackleton Blended Malt Scotch Whisky.description:
Shackleton Blended Malt has been expertly crafted using the finest Highland malt whiskies to recreate the style of the Rare Old Highland Malt commissioned by Sir Ernest Shackleton for his 1907 expedition to the South Pole.  

The original whisky was lost for a century before being recovered in 2007 by the Antarctic Heritage Trust, frozen in the ice under Shackleton’s base camp hut.

As whisky bold as its history, Shackleton's rich flavor profile is fit for the adventurous palate.

The St-Germain Gin & Tonic.description: This classic and easy-to-make cocktail is elevated by the addition of St-Germain, making it an even more invigorating beverage.
The St-Germain Gin & Tonic.name: The St-Germain Gin & Tonic
The St-Germain Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in St-Germain, followed by the gin. Top off with tonic water. Garnish with lime wedges. Add fresh basil (optional)

St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur.description:
Creating spirits is a labor of love, but few other liqueurs have such a laborious process. To gather the elderflowers needed to distill St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur, a team of 40 to 50 workers head to the French countryside and pick the blossoms of the beautiful flower. The window for picking the flowers is short, lasting only a few weeks in the spring. The rush to pick the blossoms resembles a last-minute rush by boyfriends or husbands to grab a fresh bouquet on Valentine's Day, but St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur boasts more satisfied recipients. Once picked, a race starts to begin the distillation process as the delicate flavors begin to dissipate only a short time after harvest.
The elderflowers undergo a maceration process that accentuates and perpetuates their delicate flavor and aroma. The process has taken over 100 years to perfect, which makes mastery of video games look far less impressive. Workers mix the elderflower blossoms with a small amount of citrus fruits and cane sugar to heighten the subtle flavor, but the result is nothing short of spectacular. It is a delicate, balanced liqueur that delivers hints of pear, apricot, lychee and grapefruit zest. Despite the fruit presence, it has a bit of tartness to balance it out. It's not exactly like a liquid Sweet Tart, and only an actual taste gives you the sense of its true flavor. Mix it with champagne or other cocktails for some added sweetness, or enjoy it on its own for a mind-blowing after dinner cocktail.

Bombay Sapphire.description: Enjoyed in more than 120 countries, the tantalizing, smooth and complex taste of BOMBAY SAPPHIRE is a product of the perfect blend of the finest raw ingredients; a perfect balance of a unique combination of 10 hand-selected exotic botanicals from around the world.    BOMBAY SAPPHIRE gin has an extraordinary smoothness with the overall taste being perfectly balanced. Inspiring the imagination of bartenders the world over, the aromatic flavors and crisp yet delicate finish create versatility unmatched by other gins that can be savored in inventive long drinks or perfectly balanced martinis; in classic or contemporary cocktails.

Canada Dry Tonic Water.description: Since 1904, the name Canada Dry has been known for quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Tonic Water delivers a clear, sparkling taste with a distinct touch of quinine and is caffeine free. Transform your favorite spirit into a classic concoction and add a refreshing splash of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Tonic Water.

The St-Germain Royal.description: Simple, classic and elegant. What is there not to love about a glass of champagne with a touch of French elderflower liqueur?
The St-Germain Royal.name: The St-Germain Royal
The St-Germain Royal.recipeInstructions: Pour St-Germain into a champagne flute. Top with Champagne. Garnish with a strawberry

St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur.description:

To gather the elderflowers needed to distill St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur, a team of 40 to 50 workers head to the French countryside and pick the blossoms of the beautiful flower. The St-Germain Spritz.description: Light and refreshing, this elegant French spritz is a perfect low alcohol cocktail and can be enjoyed for any occasion, including brunch, aperitif, and dinner.
The St-Germain Spritz.name: The St-Germain Spritz
The St-Germain Spritz.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in St-Germain, followed by the sparkling wine, and finishing with the sparkling water. Stir gently. Garnish with a lemon twist

Canada Dry Club Soda.description: Since 1904, Canada Dry has been known for producing quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Club Soda offers a clean, sparkling taste, and it's the perfect addition to your favorite cocktail. It can also be enjoyed on its own for a unique, refreshing carbonated beverage alternative that contains zero calories and is caffeine free. Enjoy a refreshing taste of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Club Soda.

St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur.description:

Mix it with champagne or other cocktails for some added sweetness, or enjoy it on its own for a mind-blowing after dinner cocktail.

The Stroke of Midnight.description: A twist on the traditional champagne toast, the Stroke of Midnight is the perfect cocktail to celebrate the New Year.
The Stroke of Midnight.name: The Stroke of Midnight
The Stroke of Midnight.recipeInstructions: Pour Cointreau into a champagne glass. Add in champagne. Top with grenadine. Garnish with an orange twist

Cointreau.description:
Cointreau, the crystal clear Orange Liqueur, founded in Angers, France, remains one of the world's most distinguished spirits with over 160 years of history. 


Renowned for its perfect balance of sweet and bitter orange peels and made with only the finest all-natural ingredients, Cointreau has a uniquely refreshing and complex taste. A versatile, 80 proof spirit, Cointreau can be enjoyed as the base spirit in many cocktails, such as the Cointreau Rickey, but is also an essential ingredient in the most popular cocktails including the Margarita, the Cosmopolitan, and the Sidecar.

Rose's Grenadine.description: Rose's makes the finest grenadine syrup. It has what most other grenadines lost long ago - the rich, singular flavor of pomegranates. Used in many classic drink recipes, rose's grenadine is without equal.

The Suburban.description: This complex cocktail dates back to the pre-prohibition era where it was first mixed at the original Waldorf Astoria Hotel. The unique mix of two spirits (Dark Rum and Rye Whiskey) along with Port Wine and a few kinds of bitters makes this deep, mysterious drink a real treat to enjoy.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 ounces rye whiskey 
1/2 ounce dark rum
1/2 ounce port
1 dash Orange bitters
1 dash Angostura bitters
The Suburban.name: The Suburban
The Suburban.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into an old-fashioned glass or cocktail glass . Serve with an orange peel

Angostura Bitters.description:
You can’t—or at least you shouldn’t—make an Old Fashioned without them! Angostura Bitters are the most famous and prevalent type of bitters.  But what are bitters exactly? They are an alcoholic, highly concentrated, botanical concoction used to give your cocktail a bitter, sour, or bittersweet flavor. Because of the strong flavor bitters are added to drinks in dashes. (Two or three should do the trick.) 
This specific brand is named after Angostura, the Venezuelan town where they were first produced. The recipe is a closely guarded secret, with just five people knowing the exact formula. Angostura bitters were first used to soothe soldiers’ upset stomachs and are believed to have other healing benefits but we’re pretty sure your bottle will spend more time on your bar cart than in your medicine cabinet.

Fee Brothers Orange Bitters.description: The best bartenders and master-Mixologists know the secret to a happy customer is the magic that goes into every creation. The fine flavor of this product is obtained principally from the skins of oranges grown in the West Indies.

The Wrong Uber.description: Introducing “The Wrong Uber," an intoxicating mix of bourbon, lemon juice and a homemade cherry pinot noir syrup. After a few of these you'll hop into any black car...hopefully it's going somewhere fun! Your cocktail is arriving now...
The Wrong Uber.name: The Wrong Uber
The Wrong Uber.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker with ice combine bourbon, lemon juice, Cherry Pinot Noir Syrup, and simple syrup. Strain and pour into a glass filled with ice. Garnish with lemon rind and fresh cherries, if desired

Stirrings Simple Syrup.description: Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is a starting point for many great cocktails. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Electric Sky Cali Pinot Noir.description:
As comfortable laying out by the pool as dancing at a warehouse party 'til dawn, our Cali Pinot Noir has layers to unpack, henny! Dark and moody, yet clean and smooth — with notes of cherry, berries, and plums.

Try it chilled for a whole different vibe.

Thomas Collins.description: Just like SKYY Vodka's origins, this is a fresh take on a classic that's sure to please a crowd. Intended to be batched for a group serving in a punch bowl, this recipe can also be enjoyed as an individual serving.
Thomas Collins.name: Thomas Collins
Thomas Collins.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients in a punch bowl and stir. Serve in rocks glasses with cubed ice and top each glass with tonic water. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Canada Dry Tonic Water.description: Since 1904, the name Canada Dry has been known for quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Tonic Water delivers a clear, sparkling taste with a distinct touch of quinine and is caffeine free. Transform your favorite spirit into a classic concoction and add a refreshing splash of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Tonic Water.

ReaLemon Lemon Juice.description: ReaLemon is 100% real lemon juice made from concentrate, and it's a great alternative to the hassle of fresh lemons. ReaLemon is a space-saving kitchen sidekick, ideal for adding a delicious twist of lemon to your favorite seafood and poultry recipes, plus it's great in marinades and it brightens up both hot and cold beverages. Since 1934, ReaLemon has been a trusted brand to deliver quality lemon juice.

Stirrings Simple Syrup.description: Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is a starting point for many great cocktails. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

SKYY Infusions Citrus.description: SKYY Infusions® Citrus is the perfect way to entertain your senses. Tantalizing aromas of fresh squeezed lemon are balanced amid a background of zesty lime. Citrus has always been the perfect accompaniment for vodka, making SKYY Infusions® Citrus the ideal cocktail companion.

Tipperary.description: The Green Chartreuse gives this cocktail a wonderful herby black licorice flavor that coats the palate and the sweet vermouth pulls in a matching warm sweetness. Depending on the kind of Irish Whiskey you use it'll either add more sweetness (blends) or an earthy aspect (single malts/pot still) that adds another dimension to the cocktail, giving it a bit more depth.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Irish Whiskey
1 oz Green Chartreuse
1 oz Sweet Vermouth
Tipperary.name: Tipperary
Tipperary.recipeInstructions: Stir ingredients together with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass

Martini & Rossi Rosso Sweet Vermouth.description: Fortified wine from Italy that is distilled with a combination of more than 30 herbs and spices including sage, coriander, allspice, and Roman camomile. Used as an ingredient in many cocktails, the most well known being the Manhattan. Sweet vermouth is red in color. It is fortified with brandy making it a higher proof than unfortified wines. Also used in many cooking recipes. Vermouth has a stable shelf life and can be stored for up to a year without refrigeration.

Chartreuse Green Liqueur.description: Green Chartreuse is the only liqueur in the world with a completely natural green color. It is powerful and unique. Only two Chartreuse monks know the identity of the 130 plants, how to blend them and how  to distill them into this world famous liqueur. They are also the only ones who know which plants they have to macerate to produce the natural green and yellow colors. And they alone supervise the slow ageing in oak casks.

Tito's All Time Favorite.description: An all time favorite for a reason, this classic combo is both simple and refreshing and good for any time!
Tito's All Time Favorite.name: Tito's All Time Favorite
Tito's All Time Favorite.recipeInstructions: Fill a glass with ice. Pour in Tito's Handmade Vodka. Fill the rest of the glass with sparkling water. Stir. Garnish with a lemon or a lime

Tito's Handmade Vodka.description: Tito's Handmade Vodka is designed to be savored by spirit connoisseurs.  It is micro-distilled in an old-fashioned pot still, just like fine single malt scotches and high-end French cognacs.  This time-honored method of distillation requires more skill and effort than modern column stills, but it's well worth it. Our handcrafted technique offers more  control over the distillation process, resulting in a spectacularly clean product of incomparable excellence.  Only the heart of the run, "the nectar" is taken, leaving behind residual higher and lower alcohols.  The vodka is cleansed of phenols, esters, congenersand organic acids by filtering it through the finest activated carbon available.  Critics call Tito's "a homegrown symphonic spirit to applaud!" and say "it can go head to head with any of the worlds' greats and not break a sweat.

Canada Dry Club Soda.description: Since 1904, Canada Dry has been known for producing quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Club Soda offers a clean, sparkling taste, and it's the perfect addition to your favorite cocktail. It can also be enjoyed on its own for a unique, refreshing carbonated beverage alternative that contains zero calories and is caffeine free. Enjoy a refreshing taste of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Club Soda.

Tito's Berry Infusion.description: This berry infusion from Tito's is a fun way to add a little sweetness to some of your favorite Tito's cocktails.
Tito's Berry Infusion.name: Tito's Berry Infusion
Tito's Berry Infusion.recipeInstructions: Put berries directly into a bottle of Tito's Handmade Vodka. Hint: you may have to drink a little to make room for the berries. Seal and place out of direct sunlight. Shake or stir every so often and test after 15-24 hours for desired flavor. When flavor is strong enough, strain and discard the fruit. Mix with lemonade, iced tea, or soda water

Tito's Handmade Vodka.description: Tito's Handmade Vodka is designed to be savored by spirit connoisseurs.  It is micro-distilled in an old-fashioned pot still, just like fine single malt scotches and high-end French cognacs. Critics call Tito's "a homegrown symphonic spirit to applaud!" and say "it can go head to head with any of the worlds' greats and not break a sweat.

Tito's Classic Gimlet.description: A little tartness from the lime and sweetened with simple syrup, the Tito's gimlet is a balanced drink with a classic vibe. A true staple for any home bartender.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Simple Syrup or 1 tsp Sugar
Tito's Classic Gimlet.name: Tito's Classic Gimlet
Tito's Classic Gimlet.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

Tito's Handmade Vodka.description: Tito's Handmade Vodka is designed to be savored by spirit connoisseurs.  It is micro-distilled in an old-fashioned pot still, just like fine single malt scotches and high-end French cognacs. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Tito's Cucumber Infusion.description: For an easy infusion that is great for drinks like Tito's Gimlet or a Tito's and soda, just grab a bottle of the good stuff and a cucumber!
Tito's Cucumber Infusion.name: Tito's Cucumber Infusion
Tito's Cucumber Infusion.recipeInstructions: Slice cucumber and drop into a glass container. Fill with Tito's Handmade Vodka. Let sit for 1-2 days. Strain when the infusion has reached the desired flavor

Tito's Handmade Vodka.description: Tito's Handmade Vodka is designed to be savored by spirit connoisseurs.  It is micro-distilled in an old-fashioned pot still, just like fine single malt scotches and high-end French cognacs.  This time-honored method of distillation requires more skill and effort than modern column stills, but it's well worth it. Our handcrafted technique offers more  control over the distillation process, resulting in a spectacularly clean product of incomparable excellence.  Only the heart of the run, "the nectar" is taken, leaving behind residual higher and lower alcohols.  The vodka is cleansed of phenols, esters, congenersand organic acids by filtering it through the finest activated carbon available.  Critics call Tito's "a homegrown symphonic spirit to applaud!" and say "it can go head to head with any of the worlds' greats and not break a sweat.

Tito's Hair Of The Dog.description: Recovering from a fun night out? Try Tito's Hair of the Dog cocktail. All garnishes are optional, but why hold back?
recipeIngredient: 3-4 oz Bloody Mary Mix (your favorite or your own recipe!)
Tito's Hair Of The Dog.name: Tito's Hair Of The Dog
Tito's Hair Of The Dog.recipeInstructions: Combine Tito's Handmade Vodka, Bloody Mary mix, and ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a highball glass. Garnish with whatever you'd like! Go wild - try celery stalks, olives, dill pickles, pickled green beans, lemon, parsley, bacon, cheese cubes, boiled shrimp, etc.

Tito's Handmade Vodka.description: Tito's Handmade Vodka is designed to be savored by spirit connoisseurs.  It is micro-distilled in an old-fashioned pot still, just like fine single malt scotches and high-end French cognacs.  This time-honored method of distillation requires more skill and effort than modern column stills, but it's well worth it. Our handcrafted technique offers more  control over the distillation process, resulting in a spectacularly clean product of incomparable excellence.  Only the heart of the run, "the nectar" is taken, leaving behind residual higher and lower alcohols.  The vodka is cleansed of phenols, esters, congenersand organic acids by filtering it through the finest activated carbon available.  Critics call Tito's "a homegrown symphonic spirit to applaud!" and say "it can go head to head with any of the worlds' greats and not break a sweat.

Mr & Mrs T Bold & Spicy Bloody Mary Mix.description: Serve up some fun at your next party or gathering with the premium, quality ingredients in Mr & Mrs T cocktail mixers. Available in an assortment of flavors from sweet to savory, Mr & Mrs T mixers are a guaranteed crowd pleaser. The Bold & Spicy Bloody Mary Mix takes the Original Bloody Mary flavor and spices it up with a blend of jalapeño, chipotle and red cayenne peppers, and it’s perfected with and 95% juice. All mixers are ready to be mixed with your favorite spirits or enjoyed as a virgin cocktail, and this 1 L bottle is the perfect size for entertaining. Mix cocktails like a pro with the made-from-scratch taste of Mr & Mrs T.

Tito's Hot Chocolate.description: Adults love hot chocolate just as much as kids, and with this adults-only recipe, you'll wish it were winter all year round.
Tito's Hot Chocolate.name: Tito's Hot Chocolate
Tito's Hot Chocolate.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a large mug. Top with whipped cream

DeKuyper Creme de Menthe Green Liqueur.description: Made with mint leaves, this cool, refreshing liqueur is the key to a perfect Grasshopper.

Tito's Jalapeno Infusion.description: Tito's jalapeno-infused vodka is a great way to add spice to any of your Tito's cocktails. Try some of Tito's other recipes, but with this infusion!
Tito's Jalapeno Infusion.name: Tito's Jalapeno Infusion
Tito's Jalapeno Infusion.recipeInstructions: Slice your peppers (removing some seeds) and put them into a bottle of Tito's Handmade Vodka. Hint: you may have to drink a little to make room for the peppers. Jalapenos can infuse quickly, so test the heat every 30 minutes. When it's hot enough for you, remove the pepper slices. Use this infusion in a TitoRita or Tito's American Mule, or mix it with lemonade

Tito's Madras.description: If you want to feel like you are on vacation, make yourself a Tito's Madras and grab your shades. It's gonna be sunny sippin' from here on out.
Tito's Madras.name: Tito's Madras
Tito's Madras.recipeInstructions: Pour Tito's Handmade Vodka and orange juice into a glass filled with ice. Stir. Top with cranberry juice

Ocean Spray 100% Juice Cranberry Juice.description: Enjoy the crisp, clean taste of real cranberries straight from the bog. It’s a delicious way to get your daily dose of vitamin C and unique cranberry health benefits.

Tito's Martini.description: The martini seems simple, but everyone has their own way of making it. Shaken or stirred, the Tito's Martini is sure to please all aficionados.
Tito's Martini.name: Tito's Martini
Tito's Martini.recipeInstructions: Combine Tito's Handmade Vodka, dry vermouth, and ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake or stir. Strain into a chilled martini glass

Martini & Rossi Extra Dry Vermouth.description: MARTINI Extra Dry was launched on New Year's Day 1900. Elegant, delicate and very cool. For many it is the essential ingredient and the perfect mixer.  Characterised by its pale colour and fresh and fruity aromas - together with a sharp perfume and a tantalising sweetness - MARTINI Extra Dry is the only place to begin when mixing up a cocktail.

Tito's Screwdriver.description: Tito's Screwdriver is like a glass of sunshine that is super easy to make. Great for brunch or porch sipping, this classic cocktail couldn't be simpler.
Tito's Screwdriver.name: Tito's Screwdriver
Tito's Screwdriver.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a rocks glass

Tito's Smash.description: A little sweetness with a touch of heat, the Tito's Smash is sure to spice up your evening.
Tito's Smash.name: Tito's Smash
Tito's Smash.recipeInstructions: Muddle all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Add ice. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a rocks glass

The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters.description: A traditional marmalade scent sets off act one of the Bitter Truth Orange Bitters on the nose. This is followed by a cacophony of clove, cinnamon and nutmeg. On first taste, cardamom and caraway make an entrance and the finishing number is true orange peel oil. This ingredient supports the cast of a traditional martini but duets well with rums, whiskies and tequilas as well.    The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters are a combination of bitter orange peel and several herbs and spices that are macerated in alcohol. The first orange bitters were released in the 1880s, a time when many classic cocktails such as the Martinez and Manhattan were created. Today they are still essential for the preparation of a Classic Martini Cocktail. The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters can be combined with all kinds of spirits such as Whisk(e)y, Rum, Vodka and Gin.    Tasting Notes:  The fruity sweetness at the beginning is quickly followed by a very bitter taste. The aroma of bitter orange peel is in the foreground, completed by spicy flavors of cardamom, caraway and nutmeg.    Product Information:  200 ml, 39% Alcohol by Volume

Tito's Sonic.description: Tonic and soda water come together to make a sonic. Add Tito's Handmade Vodka and you magically get Tito's Sonic. Simple and satisfying.
Tito's Sonic.name: Tito's Sonic
Tito's Sonic.recipeInstructions: Pour Tito's Handmade Vodka in a glass over ice. Top with tonic and soda water

Canada Dry Club Soda.description: Since 1904, Canada Dry has been known for producing quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Club Soda offers a clean, sparkling taste, and it's the perfect addition to your favorite cocktail. It can also be enjoyed on its own for a unique, refreshing carbonated beverage alternative that contains zero calories and is caffeine free. Enjoy a refreshing taste of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Club Soda.

Canada Dry Tonic Water.description: Since 1904, the name Canada Dry has been known for quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Tonic Water delivers a clear, sparkling taste with a distinct touch of quinine and is caffeine free. Transform your favorite spirit into a classic concoction and add a refreshing splash of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Tonic Water.

Tito's Toast.description: A toast to Texas, this festive drink adds a little sparkle to your next cocktail party.
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Champagne or Sparkling White Wine
Tito's Toast.name: Tito's Toast
Tito's Toast.recipeInstructions: Combine Tito's Handmade Vodka, honey, and lemon juice in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a champagne flute. Top with champagne

TitoRita.description: Tito likes to do things his own way. This margarita replaces tequila with, you guessed it, Tito's Handmade Vodka.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Triple Sec or Orange Liqueur
TitoRita.name: TitoRita
TitoRita.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass or serve over ice. Garnish with a lime wedge or wheel. If you like it salty, rim your glass before mixing and pouring your drink

Dekuyper Triple Sec Liqueur.description: DeKuyper® Triple Sec Cordial brings the essence of orange to your favorite cocktails. DeKuyper's blend meticulously melds the flavors of sweet and bitter oranges from distilled dried peels for a one-of-a-kind liqueur. An essential ingredient in any bartender's repertoire, this cordial has a pronounced and lingering citrus taste. No margarita, long island iced tea, or cosmopolitan is complete without the distinctive orange flavor of triple sec.

Stirrings Simple Syrup.description: Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is a starting point for many great cocktails. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Toddy No. 1.description: Warm up on a cold night with the Toddy No. 1 from Old Forester.
recipeIngredient: 3/4oz Old Forester Perfect Old Fashioned Syrup
2 droppers Old Forester Smoked Cinnamon Bitters
Toddy No. 1.name: Toddy No. 1
Toddy No. 1.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a mug. Stir to combine. Serve warm. Garnish with a lemon wheel and cinnamon sticks

Old Forester Signature Bourbon.description: Old Forester 100 Proof is handpicked from select barrels resulting in a spicy and robust Bourbon. It is bottled at 100 Proof to maintain its distinct character and cater to those who enjoy a higher proof.

Tom Collingwood.description: Swap in Collingwood Canadian Whisky for the gin in a Tom Collins and you've got Tom Collingwood! He doesn't disappoint.
Tom Collingwood.name: Tom Collingwood
Tom Collingwood.recipeInstructions: Fill a collins glass with ice . Mix in Collingwood, simple syrup and lemon juice. Top with soda water. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Canada Dry Club Soda offers a clean, sparkling taste, and it's the perfect addition to your favorite cocktail. It can also be enjoyed on its own for a unique, refreshing carbonated beverage alternative that contains zero calories and is caffeine free. Enjoy a refreshing taste of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Club Soda.

ReaLemon Lemon Juice.description: ReaLemon is 100% real lemon juice made from concentrate, and it's a great alternative to the hassle of fresh lemons. ReaLemon is a space-saving kitchen sidekick, ideal for adding a delicious twist of lemon to your favorite seafood and poultry recipes, plus it's great in marinades and it brightens up both hot and cold beverages. Since 1934, ReaLemon has been a trusted brand to deliver quality lemon juice.

This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Collingwood Canadian Whisky.description: Collingwood is a distinct artisanal whisky made at Canada’s longest continuously owned and operated distillery. As a toasted maplewood-finished whisky, Collingwood is full-flavored and complex, with a long, smooth finish.

Tom Collins.description: An old favorite (circa 1867), the Tom Collins was created by Jerry Thomas, the father of American Mixology. He's kind of a big deal. This lemonade and gin combination is an easy-drinking option for any occasion.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Gin
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
3/4 oz Simple Syrup
Club Soda
Lemon to garnish
Tom Collins.name: Tom Collins
Tom Collins.recipeInstructions: Mix the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup in a highball glass with ice. Fill glass with club soda, stir and enjoy

Tanqueray London Dry Gin.description:
Tanqueray London Dry Gin is made with a time-tested recipe that is meant to entertain. The expertly crafted recipe blends the four distinct botanicals of juniper, coriander, angelica and licorice into a perfectly balanced spirit that has a unique herbal quality and dry finish. In a 2016 poll, Tanqueray London Dry Gin was voted the favorite gin among some of the world's most renowned bartenders*. The perfect inspiration for your own ingenious cocktails, mix our award-winning London Dry Gin with a splash of premium tonic water in a coupe glass and a wedge of lime for a classic and refreshing tasting gin and tonic.

Tanqueray was developed over 180 years ago by Charles Tanqueray, a clergyman's son who chose not to follow the family calling and instead opened a distillery in Bloomsbury, London. Not afraid to mix up brave ideas in his own unique style, he invented a gin which is still celebrated to this day. The perfect mix of ingenuity, heritage and hard work, Tanqueray is a dry, crisp gin with a rich juniper flavor that makes the most refreshing tasting gin and tonics and the driest of martini cocktails

Schweppes Club Soda.description: Schweppe's original club soda makes an outstanding mixer! Universally recognized by refreshment seekers around the world, Schweppe's a must-have in any bar or party!

Tonic Trance.description: A bitter and somewhat herbaceous cocktail, we mixed this one up for Shark Week. While researching shark terminology we came across the phenomenon of tonic immobility. We won't bore you with the details, but we will share this great recipe.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Gin
3/4 oz St. Germain
1/2 oz Lemon Juice
1/4 oz Simple Syrup
1/2 oz Grapefruit Juice
1 dash Orange Bitters
1 oz Tonic Water
Tonic Trance.name: Tonic Trance
Tonic Trance.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients, except tonic, to shaker filled with ice. Shake, then strain into a cocktail glass. Top with tonic and garnish with a lemon or orange wedge

St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur.description:
Creating spirits is a labor of love, but few other liqueurs have such a laborious process. To gather the elderflowers needed to distill St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur, a team of 40 to 50 workers head to the French countryside and pick the blossoms of the beautiful flower. The window for picking the flowers is short, lasting only a few weeks in the spring. The rush to pick the blossoms resembles a last-minute rush by boyfriends or husbands to grab a fresh bouquet on Valentine's Day, but St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur boasts more satisfied recipients. Once picked, a race starts to begin the distillation process as the delicate flavors begin to dissipate only a short time after harvest.
The elderflowers undergo a maceration process that accentuates and perpetuates their delicate flavor and aroma. The process has taken over 100 years to perfect, which makes mastery of video games look far less impressive. Workers mix the elderflower blossoms with a small amount of citrus fruits and cane sugar to heighten the subtle flavor, but the result is nothing short of spectacular. It is a delicate, balanced liqueur that delivers hints of pear, apricot, lychee and grapefruit zest. Despite the fruit presence, it has a bit of tartness to balance it out. It's not exactly like a liquid Sweet Tart, and only an actual taste gives you the sense of its true flavor. Mix it with champagne or other cocktails for some added sweetness, or enjoy it on its own for a mind-blowing after dinner cocktail.

Fee Brothers Orange Bitters.description: The best bartenders and master-Mixologists know the secret to a happy customer is the magic that goes into every creation. The fine flavor of this product is obtained principally from the skins of oranges grown in the West Indies.

Ocean Spray Grapefruit Juice.description: Made with 100% juice and the unique, invigorating taste of white grapefruit "Straight from the Grove®", it’s a daily dose of vitamin C. Plus, it has no sugar added and two full servings of fruit, so it tastes good and it’s good for you, too.

Touchdown Boilermaker.description: For a game-winning play, try a classic boilermaker: a shot of Crown Royal and a glass of your favorite beer. Touchdown!
Touchdown Boilermaker.name: Touchdown Boilermaker
Touchdown Boilermaker.recipeInstructions: Pour Crown Royal into a shot glass. Pour your favorite beer into a pint glass. Drink your shot, sip your beer!

Crown Royal Deluxe.description:
The most famous Canadian whiskey of all time, Crown Royal is a smooth blend of 50 Canadian whiskies. This is no new kid on the block, either. Crown Royal has been a liquor cabinet staple since 1939, and this blended whiskey wins new fans all the time.

It has a rich, bold nose with notes of vanilla and fruit. It's an extraordinarily smooth, creamy whiskey, and you'll notice hints of oak before savoring the long, satisfying finish.

Whether you're old school or you prefer making your own custom cocktails, Crown Royal is perfect for mixing. Try it in a classic Old Fashioned with simple syrup or in a Whiskey Sour with lemon juice, simple syrup and egg white. Or spice up your next party with a Crown Royal Flush, which boasts peach schnapps and cranberry juice.

Buy Crown Royal Whiskey online at a great price on Drizly and have it delivered directly to your door or pick it up in store.

Traditional Elderfashioned.description: A beautiful twist on this classic cocktail, St-Germain adds an extra layer to compliment the whisky notes while adding a little 'je ne sais quoi' to this old timer.
Traditional Elderfashioned.name: Traditional Elderfashioned
Traditional Elderfashioned.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add ingredients. Stir well. Garnish with an orange twist

Angostura Bitters.description:
You can’t—or at least you shouldn’t—make an Old Fashioned without them! Angostura Bitters are the most famous and prevalent type of bitters.  But what are bitters exactly? They are an alcoholic, highly concentrated, botanical concoction used to give your cocktail a bitter, sour, or bittersweet flavor. Because of the strong flavor bitters are added to drinks in dashes. (Two or three should do the trick.) 
This specific brand is named after Angostura, the Venezuelan town where they were first produced. The recipe is a closely guarded secret, with just five people knowing the exact formula. Angostura bitters were first used to soothe soldiers’ upset stomachs and are believed to have other healing benefits but we’re pretty sure your bottle will spend more time on your bar cart than in your medicine cabinet.

Dewar's 12 Years Old The Ancestor Blende.description: Dewar's 12 Year Flavor Notes: Honey, homemade candy apples, and fudge. Warm, buttery, and mellow. Juicy raisins and fresh citrus, with subtle vanilla. Clean, full, and lively. Melted caramel with a trace of oak. Rounded, smooth, and long.

Traditional Punch.description: Try this traditional drink from Old Forester.
Traditional Punch.name: Traditional Punch
Traditional Punch.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into double old fashioned glass with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon peel and grated nutmeg

Old Forester Signature Bourbon.description: Old Forester 100 Proof is handpicked from select barrels resulting in a spicy and robust Bourbon. It is bottled at 100 Proof to maintain its distinct character and cater to those who enjoy a higher proof.

Trap Queen Smash.description: Hey, what's up? Hello...this is a drink fit for a queen. Blueberries, mint and the elderflower magic of St. Germain mix this into a majestic, purple, smash hit.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Vodka
1/2 oz St. Germain
10 Fresh Blueberries
2 sprigs of Fresh Mint
1/2 oz Simple Syrup
Trap Queen Smash.name: Trap Queen Smash
Trap Queen Smash.recipeInstructions: Muddle 5 blueberries and 5 mint leaves with simple syrup to base of a shaker. Be sure to thoroughly muddle the mint to release its fragrance and oils. Fill shaker with ice, vodka and St. Germain, shake 5-10 seconds until cold. Strain into a glass with crushed ice

St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur.description:
Creating spirits is a labor of love, but few other liqueurs have such a laborious process. To gather the elderflowers needed to distill St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur, a team of 40 to 50 workers head to the French countryside and pick the blossoms of the beautiful flower. The window for picking the flowers is short, lasting only a few weeks in the spring. The rush to pick the blossoms resembles a last-minute rush by boyfriends or husbands to grab a fresh bouquet on Valentine's Day, but St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur boasts more satisfied recipients. Once picked, a race starts to begin the distillation process as the delicate flavors begin to dissipate only a short time after harvest.
The elderflowers undergo a maceration process that accentuates and perpetuates their delicate flavor and aroma. The process has taken over 100 years to perfect, which makes mastery of video games look far less impressive. Workers mix the elderflower blossoms with a small amount of citrus fruits and cane sugar to heighten the subtle flavor, but the result is nothing short of spectacular. It is a delicate, balanced liqueur that delivers hints of pear, apricot, lychee and grapefruit zest. Despite the fruit presence, it has a bit of tartness to balance it out. It's not exactly like a liquid Sweet Tart, and only an actual taste gives you the sense of its true flavor. Mix it with champagne or other cocktails for some added sweetness, or enjoy it on its own for a mind-blowing after dinner cocktail.

Stirrings Simple Syrup.description: Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is a starting point for many great cocktails. Set the foundation of your delicious drink with this kosher syrup, 12 oz, and take the guesswork out of making a tasty cocktail. This simple tonic, pack of 6, contains pure cane sugar and purified water in just the right proportion. This Stirrings Cocktail Simple Syrup is the original inspiration for Stirrings "simple mixers" and is the critical first step for a yummy cocktail.

Tropical Coconut Margarita.description: This tropical coconut margarita is PERFECT for Cinco de Mayo. And it was so so easy to whip up! I love a good tropical margarita on any old day, but this one is especially perfect for my favorite “holiday” on May 5th.
Tropical Coconut Margarita.name: Tropical Coconut Margarita
Tropical Coconut Margarita.recipeInstructions: Muddle fresh mint in bottom of shaker with simple syrup, lime juice, Cointreau (or triple-sec).. Add tequila, coconut milk, and shake vigorously for 20 seconds.. Pour coconut shavings/shredded coconut on a plate.. Take a lime wedge and wet the rim of your glasses, then dip in coconut.. Fill glasses with ice and pour over shaken mixture.. Garnish with additional coconut shavings and edible flowers.

Cointreau.description:
Cointreau, the crystal clear Orange Liqueur, founded in Angers, France, remains one of the world's most distinguished spirits with over 160 years of history. 


Renowned for its perfect balance of sweet and bitter orange peels and made with only the finest all-natural ingredients, Cointreau has a uniquely refreshing and complex taste. A versatile, 80 proof spirit, Cointreau can be enjoyed as the base spirit in many cocktails, such as the Cointreau Rickey, but is also an essential ingredient in the most popular cocktails including the Margarita, the Cosmopolitan, and the Sidecar.

Rose's Lime Juice.description: Rose's lime juice, often known simply as Rose's, is a concentrated fruit juice patented in 1867. This makes it the world's first concentrated bottled fruit juice drink.

Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa.description: A fun, nonalcoholic take on the popular brunch beverage, this mocktail is full of fresh, tropical flavor that will instantly remind you of summer. You can also easily make it boozy by subbing sparkling wine for the club soda!
Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa.name: Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa
Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients except the club soda (or sparkling wine) in a cocktail shaker filled ¾ of the way full with ice.. Shake vigorously for 10-20 seconds and strain into a champagne flute. . Top with club soda or sparkling wine. . Garnish with a fresh pineapple wedge and enjoy!

La Marca Prosecco.description: Our delicate La Marca Prosecco has a pale, golden straw color and sparkles with lively effervescence. Opening with aromas of fresh-picked citrus and honeysuckle blossoms, the crisp, clean palate brings fruity notes of green apple, juicy peach and ripe lemon, framed by hints of minerality. The finish is light and fruit-forward with a refreshing style.

Canada Dry Club Soda.description: Since 1904, Canada Dry has been known for producing quality beverages and mixers. Canada Dry Club Soda offers a clean, sparkling taste, and it's the perfect addition to your favorite cocktail. It can also be enjoyed on its own for a unique, refreshing carbonated beverage alternative that contains zero calories and is caffeine free. Enjoy a refreshing taste of bubbly effervescence with Canada Dry Club Soda.

Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodk.description:
Turmeric Root, the peppery cousin to Ginger is known for its distinct golden orange color. Due in part to its many health benefits and unique flavor, the Turmeric Root is on the verge of having it's 'Moment' in American kitchens everywhere. We've combined fresh Turmeric root with tangy pineapple and tart lemon rind for an earthy, sweet infusion that pairs well with spicy ginger beer and squeeze of citrus.

Check out our Infusions 101 Page for even more home infusion flavor ideas!
recipeIngredient: Vodka of your choice (We used Tito's)
1 Tablespoon Fresh Grated Turmeric Root (or 1 Teaspoon Ground Turmeric)
Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodk.name: Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodka
Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodk.recipeInstructions: Place grated turmeric root, lemon rind and pineapple into the bottom of a 1.5 Pint Mason Jar. . Fill the rest of the jar with a vodka of your choice (we used Tito's) and seal with lid. . Give the mixture a good shake to distribute ingredients, and let sit in a cool dark place for up to 3 days, shaking occasionally. . After 3 days, strain ingredients out through a fine mesh strainer, and place your infused vodka into a sealed jar. . Infusion will keep for several weeks refrigerated.

San Pellegrino's sublime taste profile is also perfect for cleansing the palate and amplifying subtle flavors, making it an ideal bottled water for wines and food pairings. It’s naturally low in sodium with zero calories, too.

Stirrings Margarita Mix.description: How many times have you heard someone claim that they make the definitive, best, most delicious Margarita ever? It's a recipe we spent a whole lot of time on, so that you could make the same claim.

Maya Horchata.description:
The Hernandez family is legendary in Guadalajara for their horchata — a creamy liqueur that has been enjoyed for centuries in Latin America, Spain and even ancient Egypt for centuries. Grandma Hernandez won’t be too happy with her heirs, but they shared their secret recipe with us so the rest of the world can finally enjoy this refreshing elixir as Maya Horchata.
Maya Horchata is made with rum from the birthplace of rum, Barbados. We add real dairy cream, a touch of cinnamon, a splash of vanilla and, of course, Grandma Hernandez’s secret ingredients. For those of us not fortunate enough to enjoy an ice-cold glass in Grandma Hernandez’s kitchen, Maya Horchata can be stored after opening at room temperature for up to 6 months.
You can enjoy Maya Horchata straight up, on the rocks or in place of any cream liqueur (especially those from the Irish) in favorite recipes such as a White Russian, Mudslide or B-52…

UV Sriracha Screwdriver.description: This spicy twist on the classic screwdriver will keep you and your taste buds on your toes.

recipeIngredient:
1 part Bulldog London Dry Gin
1 part Sweet Vermouth
1/2 part Campari
1/2 part Aperol
Orange Segments and Zest
Unusual Negroni.name: Unusual Negroni
Unusual Negroni.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well and pour over ice into an old fashioned glass. Garnish with orange zest and an orange slice

Aperol.description:
Aperol is a classic Italian aperitif and key ingredient in Italy’s most popular cocktail, the Aperol Spritz. Its low alcohol content makes it perfect for daytime. Bright orange in color, its unique bittersweet taste is derived from sweet and bitter oranges, herbs and roots. It is a secret recipe that has remained unchanged, since its creation in 1919.
An Aperol Spritz is unforgettably delicious and the perfect way to enjoy a weekend brunch or after work drink with friends.

Campari.description:
For over 150 years, Campari has been a favorite liqueur for drinkers with different tastes. The liquid is a dark red color and is often mixed with other alcohols and non-alcoholic drinks for cocktails. The drink was created in 1860.
 
Depending on where the Campari is sold, the alcohol content ranges from 20.5 percent to 28 percent. When you smell Campari, you'll be reminded of pomegranate, strawberry, spicy herbs, bitter orange and cherry. The flavor starts off sweet and is followed by an herbal, spicy taste. After that, the bitterness of the drink starts to build. This is a wholly unique drink.

The recipe and creation process of Campari is still a secret to this day. Depending on your source, even the number of ingredients changes (ranging from 20 to 80). However, there are a few ingredients that are known. Campari includes fruits in water and alcohol as well as an infusion of herbs.

The most common ways to drink Campari are in cocktails, with prosecco or with soda water. While you can drink it neat, many have trouble with the bitter taste. Because of this, many of the mixed drinks that use Campari are strong flavored as well.

The most well-known drink using Campari is a Negroni. A Negroni can be served either straight up or on the rocks. All you need for this classic mixed drink is one ounce of dry gin, one ounce of Campari and one ounce of sweet vermouth. Mix these three together either in a mixing glass with ice or mix them right in the glass with some ice.

Another great Campari-based mixed drink is the Jasmine. In a cocktail shaker, combine one-and-a-half ounces of gin, three-quarters of an ounce of fresh-squeezed lemon juice, a quarter ounce of Campari and a quarter ounce of Cointreau. Fill the shaker with ice and shake for about 10 seconds. Strain your drink into a cocktail glass. Don't forget to add a lemon twist garnish for the perfect bold drink.

Buy Campari online through Drizly and have it delivered directly to your door or pick it up in store.

Bulldog London Dry Gin.description: Less juniper heavy and more dominantly citrus, BULLDOG is a refreshing gin that is smooth enough to drink on the rocks, bold enough to perfect the gin & tonic, and versatile enough to shake up any cocktail.

Urban Jungle.description: Made with the first bottled bourbon, the Urban Jungle has a tropical twist.

Urban Jungle.name: Urban Jungle
Urban Jungle.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in shakerwith ice. Shake vigorously. Strain into Collins glass with fresh ice . Garnish with a pineapple leaf, a lime wheel, and mint leaves
